page.title: 05SWAN HILL DAIRY IN PRENTON
page.content: {Swan Hill Dairy}was built in 1931. It is a large, brick building on a busy main road. The front of the main building is set back 45 metres from the main roadway and the space left has been made into gardens. The Dairy has three{processes.}It receives milk from farms, pasteurises it and bottles it. The glass bottles are bought and the plastic bottles and cartons are made at the dairy. There are 60 people in the workforce. The first workers begin work at 3.30am and work continues for some until 6.00pm. They all wear white hats and overalls. The milk arrives in tankers, each carrying 9000 litres, from about 90 farms, which are all on the{Wirral. The Dairy delivers to depots and about 40,000 houses in Wirral.
